35 
47 DataCommunicator::DataCommunicator(MPI_Comm communicator)
48  : m_communicator(communicator), m_rank(-1),
49  m_recvsContinuous(false)
50 {
51  // Get MPI information
52  MPI_Comm_rank(m_communicator, &m_rank);
53 
54  // Set a tag
55  setTags(TAG_AUTO, TAG_AUTO, TAG_AUTO);
56 }
57 
61 DataCommunicator::~DataCommunicator()
62 {
63  if (!m_customExchangeTag) {
64  communications::tags().trash(m_exchangeTag, m_communicator);
65  }
66 
67  if (!m_customDiscoverTag) {
68  communications::tags().trash(m_discoverTag, m_communicator);
69  }
70 
71  if (!m_customNotificationTag) {
72  communications::tags().trash(m_notificationTag, m_communicator);
73  }
74 
75  if (!m_customExchangeTag || !m_customDiscoverTag || !m_customNotificationTag) {
76  MPI_Barrier(m_communicator);
77  }
78 }
79 
85 const MPI_Comm & DataCommunicator::getCommunicator() const
86 {
87  return m_communicator;
88 }
89 
100 void DataCommunicator::finalize(bool synchronous)
101 {
102  // Cancels all sends
103  cancelAllSends(synchronous);
104 
105  // Cancels all receives
106  cancelAllRecvs(synchronous);
107 }
108 
117 void DataCommunicator::setTag(int exchangeTag)
118 {
119  setExchangeTag(exchangeTag);
120 }
121 
132 void DataCommunicator::setTags(int exchangeTag, int discoverTag, int notificationTag)
133 {
134  setExchangeTag(exchangeTag);
135  setDiscoverTag(discoverTag);
136  setNotificationTag(notificationTag);
137 }
138 
147 void DataCommunicator::setExchangeTag(int tag)
148 {
149  m_customExchangeTag = (tag != TAG_AUTO);
150  if (m_customExchangeTag) {
151  m_exchangeTag = tag;
152  } else {
153  m_exchangeTag = communications::tags().generate(m_communicator);
154  }
155 }
156 
165 void DataCommunicator::setDiscoverTag(int tag)
166 {
167  m_customDiscoverTag = (tag != TAG_AUTO);
168  if (m_customDiscoverTag) {
169  m_discoverTag = tag;
170  } else {
171  m_discoverTag = communications::tags().generate(m_communicator);
172  }
173 }
174 
183 void DataCommunicator::setNotificationTag(int tag)
184 {
185  m_customNotificationTag = (tag != TAG_AUTO);
186  if (m_customNotificationTag) {
187  m_notificationTag = tag;
188  } else {
189  m_notificationTag = communications::tags().generate(m_communicator);
190  }
191 }

244 void DataCommunicator::setRecvsContinuous(bool enabled)
245 {
246  if (m_recvsContinuous == enabled) {
247  return;
248  }
249 
250  cancelAllRecvs(true);
251 
252  int nRecvBuffers = m_recvBuffers.size();
253  for (int k = 0; k < nRecvBuffers; ++k) {
254  size_t size = m_recvBuffers[k].getSize();
255  m_recvBuffers[k] = RecvBuffer(size, enabled);
256  }
257 
258  m_recvsContinuous = enabled;
259 
260  startAllRecvs();
261 }
262 
269 bool DataCommunicator::areRecvsContinuous()
270 {
271  return m_recvsContinuous;
272 }
273 
284 void DataCommunicator::discoverSends()
285 {
286  // Cancel current sends
287  clearAllSends();
288 
289  // Send the data sizes with a synchronous send
290  int nRecvs = getRecvCount();
291 
292  std::vector<long> discoverSizes(nRecvs, 0);
293  std::vector<MPI_Request> discoverRequests(nRecvs, MPI_REQUEST_NULL);
294  for (int i = 0; i < nRecvs; ++i) {
295  int rank = m_recvRanks[i];
296  RecvBuffer &buffer = m_recvBuffers[i];
297  discoverSizes[i] = buffer.getSize();
298  MPI_Issend(discoverSizes.data() + i, 1, MPI_LONG, rank, m_discoverTag, m_communicator, discoverRequests.data() + i);
299  }
300 
301  // Receive the data sizes and set the sends
302  int localDiscoverSendsCompleted = 0;
303  MPI_Request exchangeCompletedRequest;
304  while (true) {
305  // If there are messagea available receive them and set the sends
306  int messageAvailable = 1;
307  while (messageAvailable) {
308  MPI_Status status;
309  MPI_Iprobe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, m_discoverTag, m_communicator, &messageAvailable, &status);
310  if (messageAvailable) {
311  long dataSize;
312  MPI_Recv(&dataSize, 1, MPI_LONG, status.MPI_SOURCE, m_discoverTag, m_communicator, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
313  setSend(status.MPI_SOURCE, dataSize);
314  }
315  }
316 
317  // If all the sends are complete notify it
318  if (!localDiscoverSendsCompleted) {
319  MPI_Testall(discoverRequests.size(), discoverRequests.data(), &localDiscoverSendsCompleted, MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
320  if (localDiscoverSendsCompleted) {
321  MPI_Ibarrier(m_communicator, &exchangeCompletedRequest);
322  }
323  }
324 
325  // If all sends are completed, check if also the other processes have
326  // completed the sends. Sice these are synchronous sends, they will
327  // be makred as completed only when the corresponding receive has
328  // completed. When all processes have completed the send/recevies
329  // all sizes have been exchanged.
330  if (localDiscoverSendsCompleted) {
331  int exchangeCompleted = 0;
332  MPI_Test(&exchangeCompletedRequest, &exchangeCompleted, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
333  if (exchangeCompleted) {
334  break;
335  }
336  }
337  }
338 
339  // At this point we are sure that all the processes have sent the data
340  // sizes and the data sizes have reached the destination, however it is
341  // not guaranteed that the data sizes have already been received (the
342  // message is on the destination process, but we don't know if it has
343  // been processed and received). Consequently, we can't be sure that all
344  // sends have been set.
345  //
346  // For the above reason it is not possible to call this function multiple
347  // times without receiving the messages or changes the exchanges between
348  // one call an another. Nor it is possible to call a discover recives
349  // followed by a discover sends (or viceversa) without receviing the
350  // messages or canceling them in between the two calls.
351 }
352 
363 void DataCommunicator::discoverRecvs()
364 {
365  // Cancel current receives
366  clearAllRecvs();
367 
368  // Send the data sizes with a synchronous send
369  int nSends = getSendCount();
370 
371  std::vector<long> discoverSizes(nSends, 0);
372  std::vector<MPI_Request> discoverRequests(nSends, MPI_REQUEST_NULL);
373  for (int i = 0; i < nSends; ++i) {
374  int rank = m_sendRanks[i];
375  SendBuffer &buffer = m_sendBuffers[i];
376  discoverSizes[i] = buffer.getSize();
377  MPI_Issend(discoverSizes.data() + i, 1, MPI_LONG, rank, m_discoverTag, m_communicator, discoverRequests.data() + i);
378  }
379 
380  // Receive the data sizes and set the receives
381  int localDiscoverSendsCompleted = 0;
382  MPI_Request exchangeCompletedRequest;
383  while (true) {
384  // If there are messagea available receive them and set the receives
385  int messageAvailable = 1;
386  while (messageAvailable) {
387  MPI_Status status;
388  MPI_Iprobe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, m_discoverTag, m_communicator, &messageAvailable, &status);
389  if (messageAvailable) {
390  long dataSize;
391  MPI_Recv(&dataSize, 1, MPI_LONG, status.MPI_SOURCE, m_discoverTag, m_communicator, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
392  setRecv(status.MPI_SOURCE, dataSize);
393  }
394  }
395 
396  // If all the sends are complete notify it
397  if (!localDiscoverSendsCompleted) {
398  MPI_Testall(discoverRequests.size(), discoverRequests.data(), &localDiscoverSendsCompleted, MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
399  if (localDiscoverSendsCompleted) {
400  MPI_Ibarrier(m_communicator, &exchangeCompletedRequest);
401  }
402  }
403 
404  // If all sends are completed, check if also the other processes have
405  // completed the sends. Sice these are synchronous sends, they will
406  // be makred as completed only when the corresponding receive has
407  // completed. When all processes have completed the send/recevies
408  // all sizes have been exchanged.
409  if (localDiscoverSendsCompleted) {
410  int exchangeCompleted = 0;
411  MPI_Test(&exchangeCompletedRequest, &exchangeCompleted, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
412  if (exchangeCompleted) {
413  break;
414  }
415  }
416  }
417 
418  // At this point we are sure that all the processes have sent the data
419  // sizes and the data sizes have reached the destination, however it is
420  // not guaranteed that the data sizes have already been received (the
421  // message is on the destination process, but we don't know if it has
422  // been processed and received). Consequently, we can't be sure that all
423  // receives have been set.
424  //
425  // For the above reason it is not possible to call this function multiple
426  // times without receiving the messages or changes the exchanges between
427  // one call an another. Nor it is possible to call a discover recives
428  // followed by a discover sends (or viceversa) without receviing the
429  // messages or canceling them in between the two calls.
430 }
431 
437 void DataCommunicator::clearSend(int rank)
438 {
439  if (m_sendIds.count(rank) == 0) {
440  return;
441  }
442 
443  // Cancel waiting send
444  cancelSend(rank);
445 
446  // Remove the send associated to the specified rank
447  int id = m_sendIds[rank];
448  m_sendIds.erase(rank);
449  for (auto &entry : m_sendIds) {
450  if (entry.second > id) {
451  entry.second--;
452  }
453  }
454 
455  m_sendRanks.erase(m_sendRanks.begin() + id);
456  m_sendRequests.erase(m_sendRequests.begin() + id);
457  m_sendBuffers.erase(m_sendBuffers.begin() + id);
458 }
459 
465 void DataCommunicator::clearRecv(int rank)
466 {
467  if (m_recvIds.count(rank) == 0) {
468  return;
469  }
470 
471  // Cancel waiting recv
472  cancelRecv(rank);
473 
474  // Remove the recv associated to the specified rank
475  int id = m_recvIds[rank];
476  m_recvIds.erase(rank);
477  for (auto &entry : m_recvIds) {
478  if (entry.second > id) {
479  entry.second--;
480  }
481  }
482 
483  m_recvRanks.erase(m_recvRanks.begin() + id);
484  m_recvRequests.erase(m_recvRequests.begin() + id);
485  m_recvBuffers.erase(m_recvBuffers.begin() + id);
486 }
487 
498 void DataCommunicator::clearAllSends(bool synchronous)
499 {
500  // Cancel waiting sends
501  cancelAllSends(synchronous);
502 
503  // Clear the sends
504  m_sendRanks.clear();
505  m_sendIds.clear();
506  m_sendRequests.clear();
507  m_sendBuffers.clear();
508 }
509 
520 void DataCommunicator::clearAllRecvs(bool synchronous)
521 {
522  // Cancel waiting receives
523  cancelAllRecvs(synchronous);
524 
525  // Clear data associated to the recevies
526  m_recvRanks.clear();
527  m_recvIds.clear();
528  m_recvRequests.clear();
529  m_recvBuffers.clear();
530 }
531 
538 void DataCommunicator::setSend(int rank, long length)
539 {
540  // Clear the send associated to the rank
541  clearSend(rank);
542 
543  // Set send info
544  int id = m_sendIds.size();
545  m_sendIds[rank] = id;
546 
547  m_sendRanks.push_back(rank);
548  m_sendRequests.push_back(MPI_REQUEST_NULL);
549  m_sendBuffers.emplace_back(length);
550 }
551 
558 void DataCommunicator::setRecv(int rank, long length)
559 {
560  // Clear the recv associated to the rank
561  clearRecv(rank);
562 
563  // Set recv info
564  int id = m_recvIds.size();
565  m_recvIds[rank] = id;
566 
567  m_recvRanks.push_back(rank);
568  m_recvRequests.push_back(MPI_REQUEST_NULL);
569  m_recvBuffers.emplace_back(length, m_recvsContinuous);
570 
571  // If the receives are continous start the receive
572  if (areRecvsContinuous()) {
573  _startRecv(rank);
574  }
575 }
576 
583 void DataCommunicator::resizeSend(int rank, long size)
584 {
585  // If there is no send associate to the specified rank we have to set
586  // a new send from scratch
587  if (m_sendIds.count(rank) == 0) {
588  setSend(rank, size);
589  return;
590  }
591 
592  // Cancel the send associated to the process
593  cancelSend(rank);
594 
595  // Resize the buffer
596  int id = m_sendIds[rank];
597  m_sendBuffers[id].setSize(size);
598 }
599 
606 void DataCommunicator::resizeRecv(int rank, long size)
607 {
608  // If there is no receive associate to the specified rank we have to set
609  // a new receive from scratch
610  if (m_recvIds.count(rank) == 0) {
611  setRecv(rank, size);
612  return;
613  }
614 
615  // Cancel the receive associated to the process
616  cancelRecv(rank);
617 
618  // Resize the buffer
619  int id = m_recvIds[rank];
620  m_recvBuffers[id].setSize(size);
621 }
622 
628 int DataCommunicator::getSendCount()
629 {
630  return m_sendBuffers.size();
631 }

638 int DataCommunicator::getRecvCount()
639 {
640  return m_recvBuffers.size();
641 }

663  return m_recvRanks;

672 SendBuffer & DataCommunicator::getSendBuffer(int rank)
673 {
674  int id = m_sendIds.at(rank);
675 
676  return m_sendBuffers[id];
677 }
678 
685 RecvBuffer & DataCommunicator::getRecvBuffer(int rank)
686 {
687  int id = m_recvIds.at(rank);
688 
689  return m_recvBuffers[id];
690 }
691 
697 void DataCommunicator::startSend(int dstRank)
698 {
699  // Wait for the previous send to finish
700  waitSend(dstRank);
701 
702  // If the buffer is a double buffer, swap it
703  int id = m_sendIds.at(dstRank);
704  SendBuffer &sendBuffer = m_sendBuffers[id];
705  if (sendBuffer.isDouble()) {
706  sendBuffer.swap();
707  }
708 
709  // Start the send
710  _startSend(dstRank);
711 }
712 
716 void DataCommunicator::startAllSends()
717 {
718  for (int rank : m_sendRanks) {
719  startSend(rank);
720  }
721 }
722 
728 void DataCommunicator::_startSend(int dstRank)
729 {
730  // Get the buffer
731  int id = m_sendIds.at(dstRank);
732  SendBuffer &sendBuffer = m_sendBuffers[id];
733  OBinaryStream &buffer = sendBuffer.getBack();
734 
735  // Start the send
736  int chunkSize = buffer.getChunkSize();
737  MPI_Datatype chunkDataType = getChunkDataType(chunkSize);
738 
739  MPI_Isend(buffer.data(), buffer.getChunkCount(), chunkDataType, dstRank, m_exchangeTag,
740  m_communicator, &m_sendRequests[id]);
741 }
742 
748 void DataCommunicator::startRecv(int srcRank)
749 {
750  // Wait for the previous receive to finish
751  waitRecv(srcRank);
752 
753  // Start the recevier
754  _startRecv(srcRank);
755 }
756 
760 void DataCommunicator::startAllRecvs()
761 {
762  for (int rank : m_recvRanks) {
763  startRecv(rank);
764  }
765 }
766 
772 void DataCommunicator::_startRecv(int srcRank)
773 {
774  // Reset the position of the buffer
775  int id = m_recvIds.at(srcRank);
776  IBinaryStream &buffer = m_recvBuffers[id].getBack();
777  buffer.seekg(0);
778 
779  // Start the receive
780  int chunkSize = buffer.getChunkSize();
781  MPI_Datatype chunkDataType = getChunkDataType(chunkSize);
782 
783  MPI_Irecv(buffer.data(), buffer.getChunkCount(), chunkDataType, srcRank, m_exchangeTag,
784  m_communicator, &m_recvRequests[id]);
785 }
786 
797 int DataCommunicator::waitAnySend(const std::vector<int> &blackList)
798 {
799  // Exclude blackListed ranks
800  std::vector<MPI_Request> requestList(m_sendRequests);
801  for (const int rank : blackList) {
802  int id = m_sendIds.at(rank);
803  requestList[id] = MPI_REQUEST_NULL;
804  }
805 
806  // Wait for a send to complete
807  int id;
808  MPI_Waitany(requestList.size(), requestList.data(), &id, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
809  if (id == MPI_UNDEFINED) {
810  return MPI_UNDEFINED;
811  }
812 
813  m_sendRequests[id] = requestList[id];
814 
815  // Reset the position of the buffer
816  m_sendBuffers[id].seekg(0);
817 
818  // Return the rank associated to the completed send
819  return m_sendRanks[id];
820 }
821 
827 void DataCommunicator::waitSend(int rank)
828 {
829  // Wait for the send to complete
830  int id = m_sendIds.at(rank);
831  auto request = m_sendRequests[id];
832  if (request == MPI_REQUEST_NULL) {
833  return;
834  }
835 
836  MPI_Wait(&m_sendRequests[id], MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
837 
838  // Reset the position of the buffer
839  m_sendBuffers[id].seekg(0);
840 }
841 
845 void DataCommunicator::waitAllSends()
846 {
847  if (m_sendRequests.size() == 0) {
848  return;
849  }
850 
851  // Wait for all sends to complete
852  MPI_Waitall(m_sendRequests.size(), m_sendRequests.data(), MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
853 
854  // Reset the position of the buffers
855  for (auto &buffer : m_sendBuffers) {
856  buffer.seekg(0);
857  }
858 }
859 
870 int DataCommunicator::waitAnyRecv(const std::vector<int> &blackList)
871 {
872  // Exclude blackListed ranks
873  std::vector<MPI_Request> requestList(m_recvRequests);
874  for (const int rank : blackList) {
875  int id = m_recvIds.at(rank);
876  requestList[id] = MPI_REQUEST_NULL;
877  }
878 
879  // Wait for a receive to complete
880  int id;
881  MPI_Waitany(requestList.size(), requestList.data(), &id, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
882  if (id == MPI_UNDEFINED) {
883  return MPI_UNDEFINED;
884  }
885 
886  m_recvRequests[id] = requestList[id];
887 
888  // If the buffer is a double buffer, swap it
889  RecvBuffer &recvBuffer = m_recvBuffers[id];
890  if (recvBuffer.isDouble()) {
891  recvBuffer.swap();
892  }
893 
894  // Rank of the request
895  int rank = m_recvRanks[id];
896 
897  // Restart the recevie
898  if (areRecvsContinuous()) {
899  _startRecv(rank);
900  }
901 
902  // Return the rank associated to the completed receive
903  return rank;
904 }
905 
911 void DataCommunicator::waitRecv(int rank)
912 {
913  // Wait for the receive to complete
914  int id = m_recvIds.at(rank);
915  auto request = m_recvRequests[id];
916  if (request == MPI_REQUEST_NULL) {
917  return;
918  }
919 
920  MPI_Wait(&m_recvRequests[id], MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
921 
922  // If the buffer is a double buffer, swap it
923  RecvBuffer &recvBuffer = m_recvBuffers[id];
924  if (recvBuffer.isDouble()) {
925  recvBuffer.swap();
926  }
927 
928  // Restart the recevie
929  if (areRecvsContinuous()) {
930  _startRecv(rank);
931  }
932 }
933 
937 void DataCommunicator::waitAllRecvs()
938 {
939  if (m_recvRequests.size() == 0) {
940  return;
941  }
942 
943  // Wait for all the receives to complete
944  MPI_Waitall(m_recvRequests.size(), m_recvRequests.data(), MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
945 
946  // Swap double buffers
947  for (RecvBuffer &buffer : m_recvBuffers) {
948  if (buffer.isDouble()) {
949  buffer.swap();
950  }
951  }
952 
953  // Restart all the receives
954  if (areRecvsContinuous()) {
955  for (int rank : m_recvRanks) {
956  _startRecv(rank);
957  }
958  }
959 }
960 
969 bool DataCommunicator::isSendActive(int rank)
970 {
971  int id = m_sendIds[rank];
972 
973  return (m_sendRequests[id] != MPI_REQUEST_NULL);
974 }
975 
984 bool DataCommunicator::isRecvActive(int rank)
985 {
986  int id = m_recvIds[rank];
987 
988  return (m_recvRequests[id] != MPI_REQUEST_NULL);
989 }
990 
996 void DataCommunicator::cancelSend(int rank)
997 {
998  if (m_sendIds.count(rank) == 0) {
999  return;
1000  }
1001 
1002  int id = m_sendIds[rank];
1003  if (m_sendRequests[id] == MPI_REQUEST_NULL) {
1004  return;
1005  }
1006 
1007  MPI_Cancel(&m_sendRequests[id]);
1008  MPI_Request_free(&m_sendRequests[id]);
1009 }
1010 
1016 void DataCommunicator::cancelRecv(int rank)
1017 {
1018  if (m_recvIds.count(rank) == 0) {
1019  return;
1020  }
1021 
1022  int id = m_recvIds[rank];
1023  if (m_recvRequests[id] == MPI_REQUEST_NULL) {
1024  return;
1025  }
1026 
1027  MPI_Cancel(&m_recvRequests[id]);
1028  MPI_Request_free(&m_recvRequests[id]);
1029 }
1030 
1042 void DataCommunicator::cancelAllSends(bool synchronous)
1043 {
1044  // Cancel all the sends
1045  for (int rank : m_sendRanks) {
1046  cancelSend(rank);
1047  }
1048 
1049  // Early return if no synchronization is needed
1050  if (!synchronous) {
1051  return;
1052  }
1053 
1054  // Notify that the sends have been canceled
1055  //
1056  // The tag of the notifications has to be different from the tag used for
1057  // data size discovery. We may have a scenario like the following:
1058  //
1059  // discoverRecvs(); # <-- This call is using the discover tag
1060  //
1061  // startAllRecvs();
1062  //
1063  // <User fill send buffers>
1064  //
1065  // startAllSends();
1066  //
1067  // waitAllRecvs();
1068  //
1069  // waitAllSends();
1070  //
1071  // cancelAllSends(true); # <-- This call is using the notification tag
1072  //
1073  // cancelAllrecvs(true); # <-- This call is using the notification tag
1074  //
1075  // If a process completes all its exchanges, it may reach the function
1076  // that cancels the sends while other processes are still discovering
1077  // the receives. Thats's because data size discovery is a non-blocking
1078  // operation. At the end of data size discovery we know that the data
1079  // sizes for the recevies has reached the destination processes, but it
1080  // not guaranteed that the messages have been processed. What can happend
1081  // is that a process can exit from the function while other processes are
1082  // still receving/processing the recevied messages (so they are still
1083  // setting the receives). The notification issued when canceling the
1084  // sends may than be catched by the processes that are still discovering
1085  // the receives. To avoid this discover tags and notification tags have
1086  // to be different.
1087 
1088  // Start auxiliary receives for handling synchronization
1089  //
1090  // We will receive a notification from all the processes for which a
1091  // receive has been set. A notification equal to one means that the
1092  // send request on that process that matches the receive of this rank has
1093  // been successfully cancelled.
1094  int nRecvNotifications = getRecvCount();
1095  std::vector<MPI_Request> recvNotificationRequests(nRecvNotifications);
1096  std::vector<int> remoteCancelCompleted(nRecvNotifications, 0);
1097  for (int i = 0; i < nRecvNotifications; ++i) {
1098  int rank = m_recvRanks[i];
1099  MPI_Irecv(remoteCancelCompleted.data() + i, 1, MPI_INT, rank, m_notificationTag, m_communicator, &recvNotificationRequests[i]);
1100  }
1101 
1102  // Notify that the sends have been canceled
1103  //
1104  // We will send a notification to all processes for wich a send has been
1105  // set. A notification equal to one means that the send request was
1106  // successfully cancelled.
1107  int nSendNotifications = getSendCount();
1108  std::vector<MPI_Request> sendNotificationRequests(nSendNotifications);
1109  std::vector<int> cancelCompleted(nSendNotifications, 1);
1110  for (int i = 0; i < nSendNotifications; ++i) {
1111  int rank = m_sendRanks[i];
1112  MPI_Isend(cancelCompleted.data() + i, 1, MPI_INT, rank, m_notificationTag, m_communicator, &sendNotificationRequests[i]);
1113  }
1114 
1115  // Synchronize with other processes
1116  //
1117  // Wait until all processes involved in data exchanging cancel their
1118  // send requests.
1119  MPI_Waitall(nRecvNotifications, recvNotificationRequests.data(), MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
1120  for (int i = 0; i < nRecvNotifications; ++i) {
1121  if (!remoteCancelCompleted[i]) {
1122  log::cout() << "Unable to properly cancel the sends.";
1123  MPI_Abort(m_communicator, 1);
1124  }
1125  }
1126 
1127  // Wait until the notifications have been sent
1128  MPI_Waitall(nSendNotifications, sendNotificationRequests.data(), MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
1129 
1130 #if BITPIT_ENABLE_DEBUG
1131  // Wait until all processes cancel the sends
1132  MPI_Barrier(m_communicator);
1133 #endif
1134 }
1135 
1147 void DataCommunicator::cancelAllRecvs(bool synchronous)
1148 {
1149  // Cancel all the receives
1150  for (int rank : m_recvRanks) {
1151  cancelRecv(rank);
1152  }
1153 
1154  // Early return if no synchronization is needed
1155  if (!synchronous) {
1156  return;
1157  }
1158 
1159  // Notify that the sends have been canceled
1160  //
1161  // The tag of the notifications has to be different from the tag used for
1162  // data size discovery. See comment in 'cancelAllSends' function for an
1163  // explanation.
1164 
1165  // Start auxiliary receives for handling synchronization
1166  //
1167  // We will receive a notification from all the processes for which a
1168  // send has been set. A notification equal to one means that the receive
1169  // request on that process that matches the send of this rank has
1170  // been successfully cancelled.
1171  int nRecvNotifications = getSendCount();
1172  std::vector<MPI_Request> recvNotificationRequests(nRecvNotifications);
1173  std::vector<int> remoteCancelCompleted(nRecvNotifications, 0);
1174  for (int i = 0; i < nRecvNotifications; ++i) {
1175  int rank = m_sendRanks[i];
1176  MPI_Irecv(remoteCancelCompleted.data() + i, 1, MPI_INT, rank, m_notificationTag, m_communicator, &recvNotificationRequests[i]);
1177  }
1178 
1179  // Notify that the receives have been canceled
1180  //
1181  // We will send a notification to all processes for wich a receive has been
1182  // set. A notification equal to one means that the receive request was
1183  // successfully cancelled.
1184  int nSendNotifications = getRecvCount();
1185  std::vector<MPI_Request> sendNotificationRequests(nSendNotifications);
1186  std::vector<int> cancelCompleted(nSendNotifications, 1);
1187  for (int i = 0; i < nSendNotifications; ++i) {
1188  int rank = m_recvRanks[i];
1189  MPI_Isend(cancelCompleted.data() + i, 1, MPI_INT, rank, m_notificationTag, m_communicator, &sendNotificationRequests[i]);
1190  }
1191 
1192  // Synchronize with other processes
1193  //
1194  // Wait until all processes involved in data exchanging cancel their
1195  // receive requests.
1196  MPI_Waitall(nRecvNotifications, recvNotificationRequests.data(), MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
1197  for (int i = 0; i < nRecvNotifications; ++i) {
1198  if (!remoteCancelCompleted[i]) {
1199  log::cout() << "Unable to properly cancel the receives.";
1200  MPI_Abort(m_communicator, 1);
1201  }
1202  }
1203 
1204  // Wait until the notifications have been sent
1205  MPI_Waitall(nSendNotifications, sendNotificationRequests.data(), MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
1206 
1207 #if BITPIT_ENABLE_DEBUG
1208  // Wait until all processes cancel the receives
1209  MPI_Barrier(m_communicator);
1210 #endif
1211 }
1212 
1219 MPI_Datatype DataCommunicator::getChunkDataType(int chunkSize) const
1220 {
1221  MPI_Datatype chunkDataType;
1222  if (chunkSize == 1) {
1223  chunkDataType = MPI_CHAR;
1224  } else {
1225  MPI_Type_contiguous(chunkSize, MPI_CHAR, &chunkDataType);
1226  MPI_Type_commit(&chunkDataType);
1227  }
1228 
1229  return chunkDataType;
1230 }
1231 
1232 }
1233 
1234 #endif
